ygData.subject: Re: Body Recovery
ygData.msgSnippet: I made the same mistake as a young lad of the 6th Tier.  I was going to use the hollow tree for a resting area and found meself at the bottom of the gnolls
ygData.messageBody:
I made the same mistake as a young lad of the 6th
Tier. I was going to use the hollow tree for a resting
area and found meself at the bottom of the gnolls
dungeon. I was still bare except for my kelt and rusty
longsword, yet I still felt the need to try to retrieve my
few possesions. Call it stupidity if you will, but I was
able to retrieve my corpse and make it back out alive.

Angarth, Clan Anstruther, Warrior of the 15th Tier
"Periissem ni periisem"


> ----------
> From: Patricia Halas[SMTP:patty_halas@...]
> Reply To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Sent: Friday, June 04, 1999 10:09 AM
> To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Subject: [warriors_eq] Body Recovery
>
> From: Patricia Halas <patty_halas@...>
>
> Ahh, understand I risk losing my equipment if the world crashes while I am
>
> camping and my body is left in the open desert (or at the inn in Oasis as
> it
> is now), but I must trust in the will of my lord and protector Rallos Zek.
>
> When I was a young warrior of the 5th Rank I fell down the hole on the top
>
> level of black burrow and was forced to leave my body and all my brand new
>
> patchwork armor. No problem, Rallos Zek gave me the power to start anew
> and
> rebuild my weath until I now have half banded and half ring mail, a
> combine
> long sword, a fine steel long sword and a fine steel 2H sword.
>
> SH** - It is going to take a whole lot longer to get that stuff back if I
> lose it. Better recover my body at lunch.
>
> btw: Will someone please help me get painbringer? tehehehe, ok, I know a
> 16th rank warrior wont last long in Sol B, but I will tag along :)
>
> For the Honor and Glory of Rallos Zek;
>
> Patty of Halas
> username: Patricia
> server: Bristlebane
>
